level.heading: Organization.
level.text: There is hereby established within DDOT the following offices and divisions:
The Office of the Director, consisting of the Offices of Human Resources and Legal Affairs with subordinate staff responsible for:
The Infrastructure Project Management Administration, with the following subordinate staff offices:
Project Management, to coordinate and manage:
Street and bridge construction project management;
Quality Control and Quality Assurance, to coordinate:
Project Management Support, to coordinate and manage:
Street and bridge construction support; and
The Transportation Policy and Planning Administration, with the following coordinate subordinate staff offices:

Mass Transit Policy, with functions to include supporting the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority ("WMATA") Board members and acting as a liaison between WMATA and the District government including on matters involving;
The Traffic Services Administration and the Office of Traffic Signal Systems to coordinate and manage:
Concurrent with any other agency's authority to do so, the enforcement of violations of motor vehicle parking offenses and the enforcement of violations of motor vehicle moving offenses;
The Rights-of-Way Management Administration, with subordinate staff to coordinate and manage:
Traffic sign fabrication and installation; and
Advertisements on parking meters, including the back of receipts printed out by multi-space parking meters;
The Tree Management Administration, with the following subordinate staff offices:

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 15-105 deleted the subsection designation "(a)"; and in par. (5), validated a previously made technical correction.
D.C. Law 17-20, in par. (4), deleted "and" from the end of subpar. (B), added "and" at the end of subpar. (C), and added subpar. (D).
D.C. Law 18-223, in par. (5), deleted "and" from the end of subpar. (C); inserted "and" at the end of subpar. (D), and added subpar. (E).

level.heading: Emergency Act Amendments
level.text: For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 6032(a) of Fiscal Year 2008 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2007 (D.C. Act 17-74, July 25, 2007, 54 DCR 7549).
For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 6052(a) of Fiscal Year 2011 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2010 (D.C. Act 18-463, July 2, 2010, 57 DCR 6542).

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: Law 18-223, the "Fiscal Year 2011 Budget Support Act of 2010", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-731, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 26, 2010, and June 15, 2010, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 2, 2010, it was assigned Act No. 18-462 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-223 became effective on September 24, 2010.

level.heading: Miscellaneous Notes
level.text: Short title: Section 6031 of D.C. Law 17-20 provided that subtitle D of title VI of the act may be cited as the "District Department of Transportation Parking and Moving Offense Enforcement Authority Amendment Act of 2007".
Short title: Section 6051 of D.C. Law 18-223 provided that subtitle F of title VI of the act may be cited as the "Parking Meter Advertisement Amendment Act of 2010".
